paper_abstract: Scientific computation is emerging as absolutely central to the scientific method, but the prevalence of very relaxed practices is leading to a credibility crisis. Reproducible computational research, in which all details of computations-code and data-are made conveniently available to others, is a necessary response to this crisis. The authors review their approach to reproducible research and describe how it has evolved over time, discussing the arguments for and against working reproducibly.
paper_title: Reproducible Research in Computational Harmonic Analysis
